title: The North has changed
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Mines and mineral resources
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural resources - Canada
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Economic conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Politics and government
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Mining districts - Social aspects
description: Once remote from the world's mineral markets, the Canadian North is rapidly changing. This film shows what is happening as government and private interests work to develop the North's mineral resources and to build the roads, railways and airfields that will bring the wealth to market. One new frontiersman seen in the film is a young geologist whose company in Japan seeks the North's copper.
